title: Harriet Grace
description: Harriet Grace has lived a happy life with her grandparents in a small signalman’s cottage near Malton, Yorkshire. She’s engaged to Ned Hainsworth, a locomotive fireman and it seems a contented future looks certain. 	However, in 1885, her grandfather starts to lose his sight and in order to keep their home, Harriet decides to man the signal box herself. When spoiled and arrogant childhood friend Eloise Rathmell discovers this, the authorities are informed and Harriet must attend a Board of Trade Inquiry. This becomes the catalyst of many changes in Harriet’s life.After her grandmother’s death, Harriet and her grandfather must move to York where she meets attractive Detective Constable Mackinnon Taylor and is offered work as a telegrapher and clerk with the York Constabulary.	On a visit to the signal box, Harriet intercepts a strange telegraph message. This message leads to the discovery of Eloise’s shameful secret, the implications of which will threaten the lives of Ned and herself as they pursue an abduction and possible murder.
author: Julia    Bell
